page.title: 11SHEEPSCOMBE CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Cricketers use the pavilion for eating and changing. When one team is all out the players go in for tea. The ladies take turns to do the cricket teas. They bring food like sandwiches and cakes and tea and squash to drink. Tea costs 60p for men. When the match is over everyone goes to the pub for a drink. Not many villagers play cricket. The older people settle for gentle walks while our parents age group likes swimming, tennis, squash and sailing. People go riding in Sheepscombe, but mostly they go to Stroud for sport. They go 20 miles for sailing. The only sports clubs in Sheepscombe are cricket and table tennis. Some people think there should be more sports facilities in Sheepscombe. They would like a tennis court near the Village Hall and a flat sports field.
